Not one or two, Ali Asgar has played female roles for a lot of comedy shows including The Kapil Sharma Show. In fact, some time ago, he had admitted that once he was molested while he was in his character of Daadi, performing at a wedding in Delhi.
bizasialive.com
Ali Asgar who is not a part of The Kapil Sharma Show season 2 says that he is bored of playing female roles as he is “mentally out of it”. Ali Asgar has been a part of comedy shows including FIR and Jeannie Aur Juju, but he only gained prominence after playing a female character of Daadi in Comedy Nights with Kapil and Naani in The Kapil Sharma Show season one.
theindianwire.com
“I am now bored of playing female characters because I have nothing new to offer to it. Unless it's written well. Now drag is taken for granted. That just because a man is doing a female character, it's funny. It is not! There's no novelty,” he told PTI.

Ali Asgar says he wants to play roles that have some newness. He has rejected many comic roles because they were not only caricaturist but also repetitive.
“If someone needed a female character in a drag, the channel or production would only approach me. My argument was: why me in a drag? But they used to say audience wants only me in a drag because I do it the best.”
Twitter
Ali says the writing of TV is so weak that he often struggles to add nuances to his characters as there is nothing new to do.
“I'm mentally out of playing female characters, unless the material is strong. You at least give me 50 percent character sketch and then I'll bring my own 50 percent nuances to it,” he said.
Ali Asgar will next be seen in Amavas, a Bhushan Patel directorial that also stars Nargis Fakhri and Sachiin Joshi in prominent roles.
